citation.article-title: Zobellia galactanovorans gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine species of Flavobacteriaceae isolated from a red alga, and classification of [Cytophaga] uliginosa (ZoBell and Upham 1944) Reichenbach 1989 as Zobellia uliginosa gen. nov., comb. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Zobellia (Zo.bel.li.a. N.L. fem. n. Zobellia in honour of C. E. ZoBell, who has isolated and characterized numerous marine bacteria, notably [Cytophaga] uliginosa in 1944, and for his general contribution to the taxonomy of marine bacteria)
Marine bacteria with Gram-negative cells consisting of non-spore-forming rods (0.2 by 1.5-8.0 μm).
Colonies are yellow or orange and possess a flexirubin-type pigment.
Cells do not possess flagella but exhibit a gliding motility, are chemo-organotrophic and heterotrophic.
Metabolism is respiratory, not fermentative and strictly aerobic, with oxygen as electron acceptor.
Cells hydrolyse the galactans from red seaweeds such as agar, κ-carrageenan and i-carrageenan.
Do not hydrolyse crystalline or amorphous cellulose.
The genus belongs to the family Flavobacteriaceae.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA ranges from 42 to 44 mol%.
The type species is Zobellia galactanovorans.
